description:
**Problem**
`ResponsePayload` is `#[serde(untagged)]` and includes multiple unit variants (`Synced`, `Initialized`, `Pong`, `ShuttingDown`). These serialize to JSON `null`, so clients can deserialize ambiguously.

Example symptom: `bd init` prints `synced` instead of `initialized`.

**Design**
Switch `ResponsePayload` to an explicit tagged representation (e.g. `#[serde(tag="type", content="data", rename_all="snake_case")]`), or ensure unit variants serialize as distinct strings/objects. Keep backward compatibility via versioning or dual-decode.

**Acceptance**
- [ ] `bd init` prints `initialized` on success
- [ ] Unit ok payloads are not serialized as `null`
- [ ] JSON decoding is deterministic
- [ ] Tests pass

**Files:** `src/daemon/ipc.rs`, `src/cli/render.rs`
title: IPC: unit ResponsePayload variants serialize as null (ambiguous)
Replace eprintln! usage with tracing and adjust default log levels
